snippet: Justices set the stage for a fresh confrontation over President Asif Ali Zardari, by giving the new prime minister, Raja Pervez Ashraf, two weeks to restart a corruption investigation of Mr. Zardari.
abstract: Pakistani Supreme Court gives the new prime minister, Raja Pervez Ashraf, two weeks to restart a corruption investigation of President Asif Ali Zardari, setting the stage for a new confrontation in the months-old battle between government and judiciary; few believe that he will do so; his predecessor refused an identical order that resulted in his dismissal from office by the court.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and WAQAR GILLANI
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Waqar Gillani from Lahore, Pakistan. Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Justices set the stage for a fresh confrontation over President Asif Ali Zardari, by giving the new prime minister, Raja Pervez Ashraf, two weeks to restart a corruption investigation of Mr. Zardari.

headline.seo: Pakistani Court Tells Premier to Push Inquiry of President
headline.main: Pakistani Court Tells Premier to Push Inquiry of President
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Court Pushes Premier on Graft Inquiry
